articles.author: Chris Morris
articles.title: Coronavirus has video game giants rethinking their trade show plans
articles.description: Sony and Oculus pull out of GDC. What’s next?

articles.author: Anne Sraders
articles.title: As coronavirus ravages the stock market, here are the biggest losers (and a few surprising winners)
articles.description: Airlines, cruise stocks, healthcare companies and tech companies like Apple all saw a brutal sell off.

articles.author: Erik Sherman
articles.title: Coronavirus fears batter the stock market, wiping out all of this year’s gains
articles.description: Details about the spread of COVID-19 over the weekend "opened the eyes of investors" as one analyst put it.

articles.author: Sy Mukherjee
articles.title: Coronavirus interruption of drug supply chain pushes Sanofi to open a firm in France
articles.description: Sanofi CEO Paul Hudson on why the French drug maker is creating a new company to manufacture medicines outside of Asia.

articles.author: Ben Carlson
articles.title: Coronavirus should not make investors panic. But it should make them do this
articles.description: Sometimes headlines can provide a dose of reality for those investors who miscalibrated their tolerance for volatility and potential losses in the markets.

articles.author: Sy Mukherjee
articles.title: Sanofi is set to launch a new European drug manufacturing firm
articles.description: Sanofi has been plotting a new drug manufacturing company in Europe for a while. Coronavirus and Brexit highlight why.

articles.author: Erik Sherman
articles.title: 5 reasons coronavirus statistics seem inconsistent
articles.description: Getting a handle on the data of a developing epidemic is a lot harder than it sounds.

articles.author: David Meyer
articles.title: Coronavirus in Italy: Europe’s first big Covid-19 outbreak roils global markets
articles.description: Five people have died in northern Italy's coronavirus outbreak, which has seen a dozen towns go into lockdown.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: Why the coronavirus is pushing gold up—and oil and other commodities down
articles.description: With the IMF cutting its global growth forecast and warning that it’s also looking at more “dire” scenarios, investors are concerned that risks to raw-material demand are worsening.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: Italy, Iran, South Korea: Coronavirus pandemic fears grow as cases spike outside China
articles.description: These bursts of infections could drive a second peak in an epidemic that’s already killed more than 2,400 in China and severely disrupted global business and travel activity.

articles.author: Karen Yuan
articles.title: Global markets plunge as coronavirus crisis rocks Italy
articles.description: Futures point to the Dow sinking by more than 700 points at the market open on Monday. The European bourses were down even further in morning trade.

articles.author: Claire Zillman, reporter
articles.title: Coronavirus infection at Samsung factory prompts South Korean firms to prepare for the worst
articles.description: Samsung Electronics shares slid as much as 3% as Samsung closed the facility.
